expression: on the tip of your tongue

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: on the tip of your tongue

step1.sentence: Her name was on the tip of my tongue, but I just couldn't remember it no matter how hard I tried.

step2.story: During the trivia game, the answer was on the tip of my tongue — I knew I had heard it before. Everyone stared at me as the clock ticked down, and then it finally clicked. I shouted the answer just in time and our team won the round.

step3.story: At the company reunion, Mark spotted a familiar face across the room and felt certain he knew the man. The name was on the tip of his tongue, dancing just out of reach the more he tried to grasp it. He smiled and waved, hoping to buy himself a few more seconds. As the man walked closer, Mark quickly scanned his memory — college, a summer job, an old neighborhood. Then, right as they shook hands, it hit him: 'David! From the marketing internship!' David burst into laughter and said he had been wondering if Mark would remember him.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 혀끝에 있다는 뜻으로, 무언가가 거의 기억날 것 같지만 정확히 떠오르지 않는 상태를 가리킨다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 이름이나 단어가 기억날 듯 말 듯한 상황, 즉 '생각날 것 같은데 안 나오는' 답답한 상태를 표현할 때 사용한다. 주로 기억을 떠올리려는 순간에 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 혀끝이 말을 막 뱉으려는 위치라는 이미지에서 유래했으며, 16세기 영어에서부터 이미 이 표현이 쓰였다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 무언가를 거의 기억해낼 듯한 답답함과 아쉬움의 뉘앙스를 담고 있으며, 특히 이름이나 단어가 생각나지 않을 때 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The word was on the tip of my tongue, but I just couldn't say it.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 단어가 혀끝에 맴돌았지만 도무지 말이 나오지 않았다.
